questions.question_text:
A company is working on implementing a software application. They are converting their complex, in-house processes into the new system. The business analyst has been asked to analyze the processes.
Which technique should be followed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Feasibility analysis

A. Develop a prototype to gather functional requirements.

Developing a prototype allows the business analyst to create a visual representation of the new user interface. By involving the end user in the prototyping process, they can provide feedback and express their concerns regarding the proposed changes. The prototype serves as a tangible demonstration of how the new interface will look and function, helping the end user understand its impact on their core business processes.

questions.question_text:
A business analyst is working on a project to update the user interface for a legacy procurement system. An end user raises concerns that the new solution will not support their core business processes.
How could the business analyst address the end user’s concerns about the new interface?

choices.B: Document the business data objects using an entity relationship diagram.
choices.C: Consult the stakeholder register to evaluate if the user has authority to influence the project.
choices.D: Develop a use case package to support the user interface.
choices.A: Develop a prototype to gather functional requirements.

discussion.content:
B - Delphi Technique.
In this case, the project team scheduled separate sessions with each subject matter expert to identify and prioritize the requirements. By conducting individual sessions, the project team is following the Delphi technique, allowing each subject matter expert to provide their input and insights without being influenced by others. This approach helps to collect a diverse range of perspectives and expertise from the subject matter experts, leading to a more comprehensive understanding of the project requirements.

questions.question_text:
The stakeholders for a newly approved project are subject matter experts who are very knowledgeable in the client’s business and will provide the project requirements. The project team scheduled separate sessions with each subject matter expert to identify and prioritize the requirements.
Which technique is being used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
After discovering that two solution requirements conflict, a business analyst should communicate the conflict to stakeholders and facilitate a resolution.

When two solution requirements conflict, it is important for the business analyst to identify the conflict and bring it to the attention of the relevant stakeholders. The business analyst should work with the stakeholders to identify the root cause of the conflict and facilitate a resolution. This may involve seeking additional information, revising one or both requirements, or finding an alternative solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Interface
Interface analysis is a technique to describe how different components or systems interact with each other and exchange information. Interface analysis can help to identify the inputs, outputs, and dependencies of each system, and to ensure that they are compatible and consistent with each other. Interface analysis can also help to detect potential integration issues, gaps, and conflicts among the systems. An organization that is in the process of replacing its current system should conduct interface analysis to facilitate a successful migration, as it would help to ensure that all current connections to other systems remain functional after the upgrade. The other options are not correct. Document analysis is a technique to review existing documents or records to elicit information or requirements. User interface analysis is a technique to design and evaluate how users interact with a system or product. Systems analysis is a technique to understand and model the structure, behavior, and functions of a system or process.
